titles: An epistle of consolation from the fresh springs of life, and flowings forth of the Fathers love (through his servant) as a tender salutation extended to the whole flock and family of God; even to the lowest of his babes and servants, whose hearts are sincere and tender towards him: for their encouragement now in these suffering and trying times. By G.W.
author: Whitehead, George, 1636?-1723.
notes: At end of text: Written in the White Lion Prison, London, in the 23d. of the 7th moneth, 1664.  G.W.   W.M.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: Society of Friends --  Apologetic works --  Early works to 1800.
